Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: மருவுக மாசற்றார் கேண்மைஒன் றீத்தும் ஒருவுக ஒப்பிலார் நட்பு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Continue to enjoy the friendship of the pure; (but) renounce even with a gift, the friendship of those who do not agree (with the world).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise person stands at a fork in their social path.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left path, they are shown warmly embracing and associating with people who are pure and faultless ('மாசற்றார் கேண்மை'). This path leads to a bright, harmonious landscape. On the right path, they are shown dealing with disagreeable or incompatible people ('ஒப்பிலார்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Instead of arguing or fighting with the disagreeable people, the wise person is shown giving them a gift ('ஒன்றீத்தும்') as a polite and final way of ending the association and sending them on their way ('ஒருவுக'). This path then becomes clear for the wise person as well.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Embrace the friendship of the pure. As for the disagreeable, end the association, if necessary, even by giving them a parting gift.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The warm embrace represents cherishing good friendship. The act of giving a gift to end a bad friendship is a powerful visual of a graceful but firm exit strategy.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The path with the pure friends is warm and golden. The path with the disagreeable friends is initially a tense, awkward color, which clears up after the parting gift is given.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A composition that shows the two different social strategies in action.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting to differentiate the quality of the two relationships.

Cultural_Anchors: Embrace the friendship of the pure ('மருவுக மாசற்றார் கேண்மை')
Abandon the friendship of the disagreeable ('ஒருவுக ஒப்பிலார் நட்பு')

Negative_Prompt: person arguing with disagreeable people, rejecting pure friends, text artifacts.
